summary: I don't watch Game of Thrones but from what I've picked up on is that one sad looking bastard has to choose between screwing his...
body: I don’t watch Game of Thrones but from what I’ve picked up on is that one sad looking bastard has to choose between screwing his aunt or screwing his cousin. Yep sounds like your average royal family reunion.

summary: Jonerys must be really innocent (lol) to think Game of Thrones is stupid enough to auto spoil the endgame of the most important...
body: Jonerys must be really innocent (lol) to think Game of Thrones is stupid enough to auto spoil the endgame of the most important season, that has taken more than a year to make with a millionarie budget. Before the season even starts. In the most obvious way: a pic saying END GAME in capitals lololol

summary: Hey, I've never done a gift exchange before.  How does the "big reveal" work?  Are these going to be posted to a collection on...
question: Hey, I've never done a gift exchange before.  How does the "big reveal" work?  Are these going to be posted to a collection on AO3?
answer: No, since this is a Tumblr event all gifts need to be posted on Tumblr on December 22. You may add your fic to AO3 as long as you make a post linking to the AO3 page. When posting the gift the first two tags must be #SanSan Secret Santa and #Recipient Name. After the gifts are posted I will reblog them to this blog and I will also eventually make a master list for all the gifts.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

tags: day 4: the mother OR gluttony OR parallels
title: The Mother
body:
Written for @jonsa-week day 4: The Mother

Sansa couldn’t be happier now she was pregnant and a mother to be, but sometimes she worries if Jon is capable of putting the well being of their child before the well being of his kingdom Westeros.

A post canon story where Jon got the throne, the girl and a baby on the way

Sansa stared at her reflection in the mirror. Her long white dress almost reached the floor, but didn’t cover her bare feet.

It could no longer cover her swollen belly either.

Tenderly her hands caressed the growing bump and a smile spread across her lips while the tiniest of movement tickled her.

Maybe the baby was a little sword fighter to be, already practicing the skills inherited from the father. Or maybe the baby was not too fond of being locked up inside a dark place, like the aunt. Or probably the baby would be like her and simply longed for the mother to read a story or sing a song.

Jon was counting the days until the baby would be born. He was preparing the nursery, most of the times following her exact instructions but sometimes simply ignoring them. And every night he whispered a few names in her ear, although none of his suggestions had actually been great so far.

Sansa was glad that for now the baby was still with her, safe and protected from the outside world and its horrors. And no matter how busy Jon was with being a king and ruling Westeros, Sansa never felt lonely with their child so close to her heart.

“Are you admiring yourself again?” Jon entered their shared bedroom and closed the door behind him. Years had passed ever since he had reluctantly accepted the crown and the iron throne and now he looked like a true king, like the true king he had always been already.

“Not just myself.” Sansa protested and turned to face him. “I’m admiring our child too.”

Jon grinned. “I’m sure the child will be just as pretty as you are.” He wrapped his arms around her and pressed a soft kiss on her forehead. “I’ve got one more meeting this afternoon, but tonight we can have dinner together and then I can come with you for your evening walk, if you want me to?”

Sansa rolled her eyes. “Are you now seriously asking me if you can accompany me?” She placed her flat hands on his chest. “As if I don’t have enough time for myself already!”

“You never know.” Jon shrugged. “You might have gotten used to my absence.”

Sansa kept silent for a moment. “I’ll never get used to it.” She spoke softly and she let her head rest on his shoulder. Even though she was barefoot she was still taller than him, but that didn’t matter. In his arms she felt safe and warm and protected. She hoped that was exactly what their child felt right now. “Will you make more time for me when our baby is born?” She closed her eyes and Jon rocked her back and forth in his arms.

“I’ll try to.” Jon murmured. “But Bran is not that great with people and telling them exactly what we mean. The others don’t really wanna listen to Arya. And I don’t trust Tyrion and Daenerys completely.”

“I know.” Sansa let out a deep sigh.

She had known what she had said yes too when Jon had admitted that he was in love with her and that he wanted her to be his queen because he couldn’t picture anyone else besides him. She had known that he’d have loads of obligations and that she’s stand on the sideline, whispering in his ear when she could and looking pretty when she had to. And she had accepted that role because she knew that Jon would be a great king and because she knew she loved him.

And at least with Jon on the throne things would finally change. For the better.

“It’s hard to be everything at once, isn’t it?” She stepped back and his glance met his. “King, father, husband, friend.”

“I wouldn’t be able to do any of it without you.” Jon tucked a strand of hair behind her ear and then he placed his hands in her sides. “And I promise that being a father will be the most important thing to me. More important than being a king.”

“Don’t make promises you can’t keep, Jon.” Sansa grabbed his hands and placed them on her belly. “We both know that you’re not selfish enough to do so. You will always think of the greater good of the country before you’ll think of us.”

Jon shook his head firmly and without even the slightest bit of doubt. “I can do that with me. And I guess I do it with you too often too, but not with our child.” Jon kneeled down in front of her and he kissed her belly over and over again. “Our child will always be the most important thing in the universe and when I have to choose between something that’s good for Westeros and something that’s good for my child, I’ll always pick our child.”

Sansa hands went through his hair and the smile on her face brightened. “You’re a wonderful king, Jon Snow.” She knelt down in front of him and pressed the palms of her hands to his stubbled cheeks. “But you’re gonna be an even better father.”

Jon smiled back at her and his forehead touched hers while he reached for her hands. “I hope you don’t regret making me your husband either?”

Sansa giggled, but then she shook her head firmly. “Of course not. How could I ever regret that? I’ve always dreamed about marrying an amazing king. I just never knew it would be you.”

“Dreams do come true, just not always in the exact way you’ve wanted them to.”

“This is better than anything I’ve ever imagined.” Sansa closed her eyes and then her lips kissed his. “Much, much better.”

summary: I don't know where that anon got the idea that most people when discussing the acting on got consider Sophie the weakest. It's...
question: I don't know where that anon got the idea that most people when discussing the acting on got consider Sophie the weakest. It's always been Emilia and then Kit not her though some people think she's gotten weaker over time. But those two have gotten the most complaint and Kit really got it b/c of Jon's lack of expressions in many scenes last season. Most people even if some might think Sansa is "useless" b/c she doesn't kill people don't have a problem with her acting.
answer: Everyone except Lena, Nikolaj and Sansa got panned last season. Sophie’s weakest acting was in season 3 when her entire purpose was to make Tyrion look good (it felt like that to me at least). She’s not really mentioned in the bad acting category, the worst thing people have said was about her voice and that she wasn’t as good as Maisie.

reblog.comment: Everyone except Lena, Nikolaj and Sansa got panned last season. Sophie’s weakest acting was in season 3 when her entire purpose was to make Tyrion look good (it felt like that to me at least). She’s not really mentioned in the bad acting category, the worst thing people have said was about her voice and that she wasn’t as good as Maisie.

trail.content_raw: Everyone except Lena, Nikolaj and Sansa got panned last season. Sophie’s weakest acting was in season 3 when her entire purpose was to make Tyrion look good (it felt like that to me at least). She’s not really mentioned in the bad acting category, the worst thing people have said was about her voice and that she wasn’t as good as Maisie.
trail.content: Everyone except Lena, Nikolaj and Sansa got panned last season. Sophie’s weakest acting was in season 3 when her entire purpose was to make Tyrion look good (it felt like that to me at least). She’s not really mentioned in the bad acting category, the worst thing people have said was about her voice and that she wasn’t as good as Maisie.

summary: If Game of Thrones posts a cover with Daenerys and Jon saying endgame it's because it's NOT.             If Game of Thrones...

If Game of Thrones releases a scene where Sansa and Jon reunite and seems like she is going to betray him It’s because It’s NOT!! They wouldn’t auto spoil themselves! They want to hype and mislead so we will be shocked with the real end.

summary: I don't think your previous anon is actually Sansa fan. It reeks of fans of other characters/actors attempts to plant ideas, put...
question: I don't think your previous anon is actually Sansa fan. It reeks of fans of other characters/actors attempts to plant ideas, put down and attack the actress that played Sansa. As for now, they can't attack Sansa without it backfired them back. So, they go after Sansa actress. It is always Sansa haters and fans of Arya, Daenerys, Jon, etc. that dehumanized, attacked, and body shaming her. Genuine Sansa fans knew that D&D are the one who ruined Sansa character and storyline in the show.
answer: You are right. I was hesitant to question anon because I have seen some people who are Sansa fans go after Sophie’s portrayal. I’ve talked about the hate Sophie received and I recently noticed that it’s been getting erased. Sophie’s defensiveness didn’t just come from the disproportionate hatred Sansa gets but people bullying her too.

reblog.comment: You are right. I was hesitant to question anon because I have seen some people who are Sansa fans go after Sophie’s portrayal. I’ve talked about the hate Sophie received and I recently noticed that it’s been getting erased. Sophie’s defensiveness didn’t just come from the disproportionate hatred Sansa gets but people bullying her too.

I’ve talked about the hate Sophie received and I recently noticed that it’s been getting erased. I’ve talked about the hate Sophie received and I recently noticed that it’s been getting erased. Sophie’s defensiveness didn’t just come from the disproportionate hatred Sansa gets but people bullying her too.

tags: give them everything they want and deserve
summary: I will accept one of four (4)  ladies on the Iron Throne at the end of the books (if it isn’t ripped apart). In no particular...
body:
I will accept one of four (4)  ladies on the Iron Throne at the end of the books (if it isn’t ripped apart). In no particular order, they are:

  1. Sansa Stark
  2. Myrcella Baratheon
  3. Arianne Martell
  4. Daenerys Targaryen

I don’t care what man is with them, or if it’s any man at all. Give my girls a crown or I will riot.

tags: i chose this one bc when i read it it blew my mind
summary: SANSAWEEK | day 5: favourite chapter -  A Storm of Swords, Sansa VII  Her boots tore ankle-deep holes into the smooth white...
caption:
SANSAWEEK | day 5: favourite chapter -  A Storm of Swords, Sansa VII

Her boots tore ankle-deep holes into the smooth white surface of the snow, yet made no sound. Sansa drifted past frosted shrubs and thin dark trees, and wondered if she were still dreaming. Drifting snowflakes brushed her face as light as lover’s kisses, and melted on her cheeks. At the center of the garden, beside the statue of the weeping woman that lay broken and half-buried on the ground, she turned her face up to the sky and closed her eyes. She could feel the snow on her lashes, taste it on her lips. It was the taste of Winterfell. The taste of innocence. The taste of dreams.

summary: it seems like sansa will still be against jon (or maybe she wont be entirely against him, she will just be wary about his...
question: it seems like sansa will still be against jon (or maybe she wont be entirely against him, she will just be wary about his decisions and would to protect him idk) do u think arya would go against jon ??
answer:
Never!!

I think there’s not much space in the series for that kind of drama again when we only have 7 episodes to wrap everything.

In my opinion maybe in the first two episodes the atmosphere is a little tense between the Starks but once the war comes the will be more united than ever.
